publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2662 Margaret Smith: energywatch "Stop Now!" campaign—That the Parliament welcomes the energywatch "Stop Now!" campaign which is designed to put a stop to unscrupulous sales tactics used by some gas and electricity companies which are on the increase and which, customers report, can include lying, bullying, misleading requests and intimidation; supports the demands made by energywatch to ensure that the gas and electricity companies’ house is put in order by (a) the Office of Gas and Electricity Markets (Ofgem) keeping and strengthening the operating licensing conditions which the energy companies must comply with and which are due to expire in March 2002, (b) Ofgem using its power to fine unscrupulous energy companies, (c) the energy companies establishing a "rogues’ register" of sales agencies and individuals who fail to meet acceptable standards, (d) the energy companies paying proper compensation to consumers for any distress and inconvenience caused by their sales malpractices and (e) the establishment of a standard format for energy supply contracts so that consumers are able to understand contracts and compare them with other suppliers; welcomes the commitment of energywatch to work with the police to combat bogus caller crime; urges the Scottish Executive to work in partnership with Scottish energy companies to improve consumer relations, and commends energywatch for raising the profile of such important consumer issues.
S1M-2662 energywatch "Stop Now!" campaign (lodged on 29 January 2002) Robert Brown*, Tommy Sheridan*
